chain_of_thought_reasoning: To find the display names and website URLs of the user who received the highest bounty amount under vote type 8, I need to first identify the maximum bounty amount from the 'votes' table filtered by VoteTypeId = 8. After getting this maximum value, I will need to join the 'votes' table with the 'users' table to retrieve the corresponding display name and website URL for the user associated with this highest bounty amount. Since we need the maximum bounty, I will use an ORDER BY clause to sort the results, limiting the results to only one entry to retrieve the relevant user's information.
SQL: SELECT U.DisplayName, U.WebsiteUrl FROM votes V JOIN users U ON V.UserId = U.Id WHERE V.VoteTypeId = 8 ORDER BY V.BountyAmount DESC LIMIT 1
SELECT U.DisplayName, U.WebsiteUrl FROM votes V JOIN users U ON V.UserId = U.Id WHERE V.VoteTypeId = 8 ORDER BY V.BountyAmount DESC LIMIT 1

sql_generation.Question: Under the vote type of 8, provide the display names and websites URLs of the user who got the highest bounty amount.
sql_generation.Evidence: vote type of 8 refers to VoteTypeId = 8; the highest bounty amount refers to MAX(BountyAmount);
sql_generation.pred_sql: SELECT U.DisplayName, U.WebsiteUrl FROM votes V JOIN users U ON V.UserId = U.Id WHERE V.VoteTypeId = 8 ORDER BY V.BountyAmount DESC LIMIT 1
sql_generation.gold_sql: SELECT DisplayName, WebsiteUrl FROM users WHERE Id = ( SELECT UserId FROM votes WHERE VoteTypeId = 8 ORDER BY BountyAmount DESC LIMIT 1 )
